page.title: 16St.Mary's Church
page.content: The original{Church}in Arkengarthdale was close to the{Arkle beck}in{Arkle {Town.}It has entirely disappeared and only gravestones remain. We know that this church was given to the monks of Egglestone Abbey before 1292.By 1812 the foundations of the church were being undermined by the Arkle beck and it had become unsafe. The new church was built with money from George Brown.It was erected between the school and{Langthwaite}and consecrated in July 1820. The congregation of 160 attended church twice each Sunday. Today the{population}and therefore the congregation has diminished. At the beginning of 1985 St.Mary's was without a vicar but the new vicar (in charge of 4 churches) arrived in April 1985.Only 1 service now takes place with a congregation of about 20.
